data.title: Occasional [Attack]Move Activity lag spike of over 100ms on RA shellmap
data.body:
It only happens rarely, approximately once in 5000-6000 ticks on average for me (no reason to revert any PRs over this) and given its seldom occurence, it might have been happening for a while already and not be a recent regression (or not even a regression at all and just more visible now that other performance issues have been fixed).

But either way, I think it's worth investigating, over 100ms on my system (i5-2500) probably means over 200ms on many other systems. It's quite noticeable because usually, all these Move-related activities take less than 10ms on my system, according to perf.log.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27662662-occasional-attack-move-activity-lag-spike-of-over-100ms-on-ra-shellmap?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix the legacy map importer not working
data.body:
On current bleed, I can't import red alert maps anymore.
The bad commit seems to be 95709f11578747dfc9e1869f074b8d686e645336.

(Not sure if this is the correct fix tho.)

data.title: Sidebar button keyboard shortcuts are triggered by repeating rate input rather than physical key press.
data.body:
Holding down keyboard keys assigned to the sidebar buttons such as Main Menu(Esc), Place Beacon(B), Sell(Z), Repair(C). Build queue short cuts and builds themselves (Function keys). Are trigged by keyboard auto repeat rate rather than physical press.

These are triggered by the OS Keyboard Repeat Rate settings and if User has these set high can effect the game. As described in issue #7941

data.title: Fix broken scripted attacks in some missions
data.body: Fixes #9693.

data.title: Refactor animation classes
data.body:
Specify pause function in constructors of Animation if required, and remove the unused pause function from AnimationWithOffset.

Cleanup Animation.cs and reduce code duplication.

data.title: Improve AutoTarget performance
data.body:
I have attempted to improve the performance of several key areas used by the AutoTarget functionality, since this is used by many units. As a bonus, this reduces some code duplication too.

On the RA shellmap, total CPU time spent in AutoTarget.ScanForTarget drops from 7.1% to 3.4% with these changes.

data.title: Unit tests for MiniYaml parser
data.body:
Parsing bugs should be collected and analyzed to create unit (NUnit) tests.

Issues to be tested:
- [ ] #9196 -  yaml inheritance breaks in conjunction with yaml removals
  - #9710 - possible fix - no unit test

Please post (links to) MiniYaml bugs here.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27652948-unit-tests-for-miniyaml-parser?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Support MiniYaml line-by-line list entries as well
data.body:
Right now, changing lists (`List`, `HashSet`, `[]`) requires replacing them.
Supporting MiniYaml line-by-line list entries as well would allow the MiniYaml merging logic to be used where additions and/or deletions are made.

Loading from both the inline list and line-by-line would allow for list additions without rewriting the currents lists.

data.title: Remove tesla boost from RA
data.body:
Fixes #9647.
Fixes #9727.

data.title: Fake structures detonate
data.body:
First commit adds the `HealthPercentage` property to the `Explodes` class. This allows actors to be killed once they fall below a certain percentage of their health.

The second commit applies this functionality to RA fake structures. Most fakes now explode at 10% of their real counterparts max health.

Before
![norm_fake](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10699673/7c529170-79b0-11e5-9f74-26eff3558def.gif)

After
![new_fake](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10699671/7b5d825c-79b0-11e5-97c5-53b506cf65e5.gif)

Previously a single rifle or flak burst would show a large chunk out of the visual health bar. Now fakes take damage at the same rate as their real counterparts. In the gifs above, both structures are destroyed after 100hp has been dealt (two grenades in this case). The gifs show the damage done from a single grenade.

WF 100hp -> 150hp
CY 100hp ->150hp
SPEN 100hp -
NY 100hp -
DOME 100hp -
ATEK 100hp -> 40hp (perhaps this could do with a buff?)

I have however buffed the fake msilo and fake pdox to explode at 50% since only 1 of each can be built, and it is pretty easy to get a couple rockets off from a paradrop now that you can select them in the air.

PDOX 100hp -> 500hp
MSILO 100hp -> 500hp

The one issue I have noticed that I discussed briefly on IRC, is that when a players fake structure is destroyed by an opponent, that player gains both a kill and a loss while the opponent who killed the actor gains nothing.

If anyone has ideas on how to solve this, please detail.

data.title: Demo truck kills
data.body:
When you detonate a demo truck using F it counts as a kill and a death
![demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10693768/3cc798ac-7992-11e5-8b67-997c8304f577.png)

When an enemy kills a demo truck any enemies killed in the blast are counted towards the enemies kill count
![demo2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10694461/30580710-7996-11e5-928d-56d1c53bce7c.png)

When a demo targets an actor and explodes as normally the owner is properly credited the kills.

On release and bleed.

data.title: Multiplayer IRC nickname should acknowledge player settings
data.body:
When joining multiplayer the IRC nickname suggestion:
- ignores the name player has chosen in the settings menu.
- the player name setting should be favored over the "last used nickname"

data.title: Boosted tesla will break the balance
data.body:
i dont even need a playtest to figure that one out 

they do get more range and damage when being boosted by shocktroopers , this is totally inacceptable beside the fact that it is a "RA2" feature ... i dont get the point why we should add every new feature to the "RA1"-mod ... as if our RA-Mod is the laboratory monkey here  for all the feature experiments

the Teslas are allready badass defense-structures , with the highest range and damage of "all" defense structures ... the ONLY thing you encourage by allies , is to spam even more artys ... 

why ? you ask ... cause allies have the weakest tanks ... medium-tanks and light-tanks are cannon fodder and teslas just have a "Grill-Fest" when allies tanks roll up ... thats why nobody is using them in a serious attack ... and thats why everyone spams artys instead 

now with the shocktroopers boosting teslas ... you dont need to be einstein to see that this is inappropriated

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2330
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4589
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8563

@Mailaender : please , we all know your "#this-is-not-true-to-the-original"-philosophy ... when theres controversy about a new feature .... but people play "Red Alert1" because it is called "Red Alert1" ... so lets "keep" it Red Alert1 atleast slightly

@pchote @obrakmann : 
we should consider to remove the "stat boost" and just have the Tesla "powered" when there is a PowerOutage ... with the help of shocktroopers ... i think that would be fair enough , cause Allies can cause a PowerOutage

@Unit158 @Phrohdoh : .... thx

data.title: Leaving a game should not boot player to the main menu
data.body:
(current bleed) 
Leaving a (multiplayer) game boots you all the way to the main menu. This is not ideal since players will probably want to join another match (and this involves more clicking) or they should at least be encouraged to join another.

While this might be more important for multiplayer I don't see why it should be any different for skirmish games (which should actually preserve all the settings from the last match).

data.title: Replace InvalidOperationException with YamlException in SpreadDamageWarhead
data.body:
I missed the `InvalidOperationException`s in `SpreadDamageWarhead` when I wrote #9450.
Closes #9631.

data.title: Add 'Flip/Mirror' functionality for sequences
data.body:
example

```
quad:                                                    
        idle: UNITS.SHP                                        
                Frames:  0, 1, 2, 3, 4,  3,  2,  1             
                FlipX:   1, 1, 1, 1, 1, -1, -1, -1             
                Facings: -8                                    
        icon: SHAPES.SHP                                       
                Start: 74                                      
                Offset: 0,0                                    
```

data.title: flip or mirror sprites with negative width and height
data.body:
currently sprite with negative width or height looks on the screen the same as with normal width and height.
This fix allow to use negative width and/or height to flip/mirror sprite. 
It assign correct points for textures in a sheet.

data.title: use right cursor for ion and nuke
data.body:
nuke and ion cursors where switched;
ion cannon was using default cursor

data.title: Actors with `Hovers` should not hover while changing altitude
data.body:
Currently aircraft "hover" while landing/taking off.
We can fix that inside `Hovers` once `Aircraft` gets its long-needed overhaul.
Also the Hover MLRS shouldn't hover while going up/down slopes (unless that requires too much of a hack to be justifiable).

data.title: Fix a crash in CheckPlayers when an actor doesn't define an Owner
Bring back the observer clock for D2k
data.body: Fixes #9461.

data.title: Check HVA files validity at load time
data.body:
Currently if you provide the game with a voxel with bogus HVA file, the game will crash [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Graphics/VoxelRenderer.cs#L203) after `Util.MatrixInverse(t)` returns `null` and `Util.MatrixMultiply()` chokes on it.
That, of course, happens ingame when you create the actor, which is far from ideal.

The reason in the case I debugged ( reported by @ABrandau ) was a bogus transformation matrix.
The exception, of course, was an NRE with no information whatsoever.

This throws at load time (as soon as you start up the game), and it gives a proper exception, which will hopefully help modders find their mistake.

data.title: Let emp effect buildings and cyborgs too
Disable hovering for landed aircraft
Show owner and faction of units in tooltips
data.body: Fixes #9571

data.title: Fix misleading Utility message.
data.body: Closes #9713.

data.title: Utility incorrectly reports that a command does not exist.
Unicode font support
data.body:
Default font does not support Chinese Character. Need a unicode font to make localization. Maybe "Source Han Sans" could solve the problem.

data.title: Fix D2kEditorResourceLayer starting NetWorth
data.body: Fixes #9704.
